summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 12, 2019, regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The Lieutenant describes MCC procedures, the discovery of Epstein's body, and reveals that the assigned Corrections Officers admitted to not performing required inmate checks and that Epstein did not have a required cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found deceased in his cell at MCC on August 10, 2019. He was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and had previously been on suicide watch.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.role: Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant at MCC
persons.context: The interviewee, a GS-11 Lieutenant with 17 years at MCC. He was the supervising lieutenant who responded to the medical emergency call for Epstein, administered CPR, and later discussed the incident with the involved officers.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: One of the two Corrections Officers present at Epstein's cell when he was found. She stated "EPSTEIN hung himself" and admitted to not performing the 3:00am and 5:00am rounds. She did not write a required memo after the incident.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: One of the two Corrections Officers present at Epstein's cell. He was attempting to administer CPR when the Lieutenant arrived. He was distraught and left MCC without writing a required memo.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Another GS-11 Lieutenant who worked the shift prior to the interviewee Lieutenant on August 9-10, 2019. The interviewee relieved him at 5:30am.

connections.description: Both were Corrections Officers assigned to the same shift and were together at Jeffrey Epstein's cell when he was found.
The Lieutenant was the supervising officer for Corrections Officer Noel. He advised her after the incident to document what happened truthfully.
The Lieutenant was the supervising officer for Corrections Officer Thomas.
Both are GS-11 Lieutenants at MCC. The interviewee relieved the other lieutenant at the shift change on the morning of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was first placed on suicide watch at MCC.

events.title: Epstein's cellmate removed
events.description: Epstein's bunkie (cell mate) was removed from their shared cell. This movement should have been documented in the inmate log.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's body
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC. Officers Noel and Thomas were present. The Lieutenant responded, administered CPR, and observed a noose made from bedsheets.

events.title: FBI interview of MCC Lieutenant
events.description: An unnamed Lieutenant from MCC was interviewed by the FBI, OIG, and an AUSA regarding the procedures and circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
FBI-New York offices, 290 Broadway, New York, New York
keyFacts: Corrections Officers Noel and Thomas admitted to not performing the required 3:00am and 5:00am inmate count rounds on the night Epstein died, which would mean any signed count slips were falsified.
Jeffrey Epstein did not have a cellmate (bunkie) at the time of his death, which violated standard MCC policy requiring inmates on suicide watch or psychological observation to have one.
Epstein's cellmate had been removed the day prior (August 9), a movement that should have been documented in the official inmate log handed over between shifts.
Neither Officer Noel nor Officer Thomas wrote the required memos about the incident, and neither had reported back to work since.
The Lieutenant observed a noose fabricated from bed sheets in Epstein's cell but could not recall if it was around his neck or on the ground.
